sentences: Ulayya bint al-Mahdi (Arabic: عُلَيّة بنت المهدي, romanized: ʿUlayya bint al-Mahdī, 777-825) was an Abbasid princess, noted for her legacy as a poet and musician.
She also composed love poems for her sister-in-law Zubaidah bint Ja`far, which was allegedly performed by 2000 slave women singers for her brother Harun al-Rashid.
by J. Heyworth Dunne, 3rd edn (Beirut: Dār al-Masīra, 1401/1982), pp.
